summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum summarizing the receipt of information from a SigNet Technologies program manager regarding the camera system upgrade and subsequent failures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held. The document references a camera system failure recognized on August 8, 2019, which is significant as it occurred around the time of Epstein's death.

persons.role: Special Agent, DOJ OIG New York Field Office
persons.context: Received attached documents and communications from the SigNet Technologies Program Manager regarding the camera system at MCC New York.

persons.name: Program Manager, SigNet Technologies

connections.description: The Program Manager provided information and documents to the Special Agent regarding the MCC New York camera system.

events.title: MCC New York Camera System Upgrade Contract
events.description: GSA contract for a camera system upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York was dated.

events.title: MCC New York Camera System Failure
events.description: Camera system failure was recognized at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, New York (MCC New York)
keyFacts: The DOJ OIG received information from a SigNet Technologies program manager about the camera system at MCC New York, where Jeffrey Epstein died.
A camera system failure was recognized at MCC New York on August 8, 2019, which is temporally proximate to Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The document references a GSA contract for a camera system upgrade dated September 21, 2018, and multiple service requests from February to November 2019.
The memorandum itself is dated November 17, 2022, indicating an ongoing investigation into the circumstances surrounding the camera system.
